pym.validator module¶

class pym.validator.FilterValidator(parent)¶

Bases: builtins.object

build_filter(fil, allowed_fields, col_map)¶
build_simple_grid_filter(col_map)¶

Builds simple SA filter suitable for use in UI grid.

Structure created by client must be:

['a', [
    thing0,
    thing1,
    ...
]]

with thing:

[fld, op, case, val]

All things are ANDed. We ignore client’s setting for op and case, and instead build search pattern for case-insensitive like (ilike). To prevent SQL errors in case column is not a string, we cast all fields to UnicodeText.

Parameters:entity – Object to pull the SA fields from
Returns:List of SA filter expressions, may be empty
RE_WHITESPACE = re.compile('\\s+')¶
allowed_case_sensitivity = None¶

List of choices for case sensitivity.

allowed_conjunctions = None¶

List of conjunctions.

allowed_fields = None¶

List of field names that are allowed in a filter expression

allowed_operators = None¶

List of (prefix ‘!’ means negation, suffix ‘*’ means case-insensitive)

field¶

Fetches the field name from key f (required, single).

Returns:Field name
Raises ValidationError:
 If field name not listed in allowed_fields.
filter¶

Fetches the filter expression from key fil (required, single).

Key fil must contain the expression as a single JSON string.

Returns:Filter expression as a data structure.
Raises ValidationError:
 If key is missing or invalid.
text¶

Fetches the filter text from key q (optional, single).

We sanitise the whitespace, i.e. we strip leading and trailing whitespace and condense multiple consecutive into a single blank.

Returns:The filter text, or None.
class pym.validator.PagerValidator(parent)¶

Bases: builtins.object

allowed_page_sizes = None¶

Default list of allowed page sizes

default_page = None¶

Default for current page

default_page_size = None¶

Default page size

page¶

Fetches current page from key pg (optional, single).

If missing, we return default_page.

Returns:Current page
Raises ValidationError:
 If pg < 0
page_size¶

Fetches page size from key ps (optional, single).

If missing, we return default_page_size.

Returns:Page size, min(allowed_page_sizes) < ps < max(allowed_page_sizes)
class pym.validator.SorterValidator(parent)¶

Bases: builtins.object

allowed_directions = None¶

List of sort directions

allowed_fields = None¶

List of field names that are allowed in a sort expression

directions¶

Fetches list of sort directions from key sd (required, multiple).

Returns:List of sort directions
Raises ValidationError:
 If a direction is not listed in allowed_directions.
fields¶

Fetches list of field names for key sf (required, multiple).

Returns:List of field names
Raises ValidationError:
 If a field is not listed in allowed_fields
class pym.validator.Validator(inp)¶

Bases: builtins.object

fetch(k, default=None, required=True, multiple=False)¶

Fetches an input parameter.

Parameters:
  • k – Parameter to fetch from input
  • default – Default value if k was not present
  • required – If True, raises ValidationError if parameter is missing
  • multiple – If true, return list, else scalar
Returns:

Fetched value
fetch_bool(k, default=None, required=True, multiple=False)¶

Fetches an input parameter as boolean.

Parameters:
  • k – Parameter to fetch from input
  • default – Default value if k was not present
  • required – If True, raises ValidationError if parameter is missing
  • multiple – If true, return list, else scalar
Returns:

Bool or list of bools
fetch_date(k, default=None, required=True, multiple=False, fmt='%Y-%m-%d')¶

Fetches an input parameter as a date.

Parameters:
  • k – Parameter to fetch from input
  • default – Default value if k was not present
  • required – If True, raises ValidationError if parameter is missing
  • multiple – If true, return list, else scalar
Returns:

Date or list of dates
fetch_float(k, default=None, required=True, multiple=False)¶

Fetches an input parameter as float.

We use the right-most dot or comma as decimal separator.

Parameters:
  • k – Parameter to fetch from input
  • default – Default value if k was not present
  • required – If True, raises ValidationError if parameter is missing
  • multiple – If true, return list, else scalar
Returns:

Float or list of floats
fetch_int(k, default=None, required=True, multiple=False)¶

Fetches an input parameter as integer.

Parameters:
  • k – Parameter to fetch from input
  • default – Default value if k was not present
  • required – If True, raises ValidationError if parameter is missing
  • multiple – If true, return list, else scalar
Returns:

Int or list of ints
